snippet: After a federal appeals court ruled largely in his favor in a copyright suit, the artist Richard Prince is ready again to show his 2008 series, “Canal Zone.”
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Gagosian Gallery will show works in Richard Prince's Canal Zone series following settlement of fair use lawsuit involving Prince; Christie's will auction Andy Warhol painting White Marilyn, which is expected to bring $12 million to $18 million; construction is set to begin on Luma Arles, Frank Gehry-designed art center in Arles, France, area that once inspired van Gogh.
lead_paragraph: After a federal appeals court ruled largely in his favor in a copyright suit, the artist Richard Prince is ready again to show his 2008 series, “Canal Zone.”

headline.main: Richard Prince’s ‘Canal Zone’ to Be Shown at Gagosian
headline.print_headline: Richard Prince’s ‘Canal Zone’ to Be Shown at Gagosian
